variants.Description in input context: A53T mutation associated with Parkinson's disease
A30P mutation linked to early-onset Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with SNCA variants to study protein aggregation.

Readout description.Result Description: A53T variant showed 40% increased protein aggregation compared to wild-type.
A30P variant demonstrated 30% higher aggregation than wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each condition was tested in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein aggregation levels < 20% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein aggregation levels ≥ 30% of wild-type controls.

Material used.Description: Yeast cells expressing SNCA variants were used to assess toxicity.

Readout description.Result Description: A53T-expressing yeast showed severe growth defects and vacuolar fragmentation.
A30P-expressing yeast exhibited moderate vacuolar swelling and growth impairment.

Biological replicates.Description: Two biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector yeast served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No vacuolar abnormalities or growth defects observed.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of vacuolar fragmentation or growth defects.
